title: Simon Cowell, Lauren Silverman and son Eric have day at pumpkin patch
text:
Simon Cowell's girlfriend Lauren Silverman and his ex Terri Seymour looked in high spirits as they took Simon and Lauren's son Eric to the pumpkin patch.

Eric, five, looked right at home as he carried a pumpkin back to Lauren, 42, and Terri, 47, who both showed off their sense of style for the outing in Los Angeles on Monday.

Lauren donned a lemon cardigan and dark blue skinny jeans for the day which she paired with white trainers and a pair of shades.

Fun: Simon Cowell's son Eric, five, was treated to a day out at a pumpkin patch in Los Angeles on Monday

Extra TV host Terri also kept it casual in a white t-shirt with blue jeans and dark trainers.

Letting her brunette locks fall loose down her shoulders, she completed her look with a black handbag and a pair of shades.

Eric sported a dark grey t-shirt that read 'Best Little Brother' in yellow writing and a pair of blue shorts.

Enjoying the sunshine, Lauren and Terri also took Eric for a spin in a go-kart with a bumble bee design.

Day out: Eric was joined by his mother Lauren Silverman and Simon's ex-girlfriend Terri Seymour who both looked in high spirits

Terri and Simon were an item for eight years before their split, with the music mogul rumoured to have given her a £6million 'parting gift'.

He then went on to become engaged to Afghan-born make-up artist Mezhgan Hussainy in 2010, but they split in February 2012.

Simon shocked fans in summer 2013 when it was revealed he was expecting his first child with American socialite Lauren - who was then married to real estate mogul Andrew Silverman.

Activities: Enjoying the sunshine, Lauren and Terri also took Eric for a spin in a go-kart with a bumble bee design

The couple welcomed Eric in February 2014. In a touching sentiment, Simon admitted on ITV's Lorraine that life is 'more simple and fun' since becoming a father, as he said: 'I see my life through his eyes now and it’s much more simple and it’s much more fun.'

When asked about what the biggest change has been in fatherhood, he said: 'When you become a dad, something clicks in you. It’s all about them.

'You become very protective and importantly, part of the reason I changed everything in my life'.
